title: I tried to get a driver's license in Malaysia.
contentSnippet: Hello. I'm Soumame, 17 years old. The other day (although it was quite a while ago), I was able to get my license in Malaysia, so I will write down how I got it here. Let me start by saying that in Malaysia, you can get a regular driver's license from the age of 17, so please keep that in mind as you read. I had a friend ask me about how to get a license in Malaysia, so I have summarized my personal thoughts and experiences here. See more

title: Read Google Sheets via API!
contentSnippet: This is a repost of an article I wrote on a different website last year. It's super easy. I will explain how to load information written in Google Sheets using something called an API. With some creativity, it can also be used as a simple CMS! Since you can use it just by copying and pasting, please take a look. Read more.

title: If you understand HTML, you can do it! Let's create a blog site with Astro!
contentSnippet: There are times when you feel like creating a blog site, right? Nowadays, you can easily create a website according to your preferences without having to use WordPress or other platforms, especially for sites of a certain scale. This time, we will try creating a blog website using the trendy framework, Astro, in about 1 hour. Read more.

title: Points to consider when connecting to a local Cloudflare D1 database with Drizzle Studio
contentSnippet: Cloudflare D1 is structured with a SQLite DB for local development and a DB for the production environment. Essentially, it follows the guidelines in the article linked below, but to use the local DB from Drizzle Studio, it was necessary to manually specify the SQLite path in Wrangler. https://zenn.dev/king/articles/3d5610429811eb We have improved this development experience a bit, so we would like to introduce it to you. Install Dependencies: Install a library that allows you to specify environment variables from the command line, created by Kent C. Dodds.

title: Send images to Eagle from your smartphone to comfortably update your library (Cloudflare Tunnel).
contentSnippet: Eagle is a useful app that allows you to manage screenshots, images, videos, audio, fonts, and more in your local environment. Unlike cloud services, you have complete control over it. However, there is no mobile app, so there is no way to update the Eagle library from another device. https://eagle.cool I often take screenshots of mobile app UI and save them, so I was thinking of an efficient way to save them to Eagle. In this article, we will explore how to securely send files to Eagle from external devices using Cloudflare Tunnel...

title: I tried creating an AI assistant to support block programming learning (Blockly × OpenAI).
contentSnippet: First, block programming is one of the programming languages designed for beginners and children, with Scratch developed by MIT Media Lab being a representative example. However, it has been found that block programming takes time for beginners to understand and there is a barrier to transitioning to code-based programming. I myself started using Scratch when I was in elementary school, and it took me some time to transition to code-based programming. To address this issue, I started developing an AI block programming assistant using Blockly and OpenAI. Blockly is a visual programming language developed by Google...

title: Looking back only on failures in 2023!

If there is something you are curious about, I would appreciate it if you could look it up yourself and ask me via DM or other means. Oh, it's finally the end of the year again. title: Localize the shadcn/ui calendar component for Japan.
contentSnippet: The Shadcn UI calendar component depends on the react-day-picker package. This is about how to localize the calendar component in Japanese. To localize it in Japanese, import the Japanese localization data of date-fns and pass it to the component as the locale prop. Import { ja } from "date-fns/locale"; function Calendar({ className, classNames, showOutsideDays = true, ...props}: CalendarPr...

title: I got stuck with GPTs Actions' OAuth.
contentSnippet: The new feature of ChatGPT, GPTs, allows for the implementation of OAuth authentication, enabling authentication for each user to extract their own data. However, the documentation is still incomplete, and there have been numerous bugs due to some rather hacky aspects, so I will summarize it for future reference. While it is possible to add an Authentication header from the settings page where only custom information other than Authentication can be passed to headers, passing other information on the web client is not possible. In this case, I was planning to call the Notion API, so the Notion-Version is required. This issue...

title: I tried hitting the Notion API with GPTs and it was amazing.
contentSnippet: The new feature announced at OpenAI's DevDay, GPTs, allows for the creation of custom models specialized for specific tasks, which can be used in ChatGPT Plus. The GPTs created can be used not only for personal use but also shared with friends or even published online. By using the Actions feature of these GPTs, based on the OpenAPI Schema, the ChatGPT agent can now execute external APIs. This feature enables interactions between various services such as Notion and GPTs...

title: Block access from the EU with Next.js + Vercel middleware.
It was fun dynamically rendering UI with Function Calling in ChatGPT.
contentSnippet: By using the Function Calling API released by OpenAI, you can pass information about defined functions to determine which function should be used based on natural language, and it will also respond with arguments following the json schema. Utilizing this information, you can execute API queries and dynamically render the UI based on the response, which I found interesting to experiment with. title: Display issue and solution for head when introducing Google Analytics in Next.js 13 (useSearchParams)

Specifically, for a moment, <html id="__next_error__"> was displayed, and the bot was unable to read OGP correctly. This article will introduce the cause and solution to this problem. The issue was confirmed in a Next.js app with Google Analytics deployed on Vercel. The problem did not occur in the development environment, but was confirmed when using yarn start. title: I tried analyzing the changes in the number of online users on a server using discord.py.
contentSnippet: In order to find the optimal timing for hosting an online event, it was necessary to collect the fluctuations in the number of online users on the Discord server. Therefore, this time, we will use discord.py, which is an API wrapper for Discord, to collect the number of online users on the server and introduce a series of steps to visualize it using matplotlib. Creating and inviting the BOT! If you have already invited the BOT to the server, please proceed to the next section. title: Why are the names Java and JavaScript so similar?
contentSnippet: Java and JavaScript, as you may know, are as different as melons and melon bread, but I was curious why they ended up with such confusing names, so I looked into it. Because of writing this article, I ended up craving and buying melon bread. In conclusion, it seems that JavaScript got its name by riding on the popularity of Java. JavaScript's HistoryJavaScript is a language developed by Brendan Eich of Netscape. JavaScript was implemented in the browser called Netscape Navigator, which was the precursor to Firefox, also from Netscape...

title: How to conditionally branch for each page in WordPress pagination
contentSnippet: This is a note when trying to change the design for each page using WordPress page breaks (<!--nextpage--> or "page break" block). In conclusion, it can be done simply by using global variables. $page is a global variable that can retrieve the page number of a post or a static page. In this code example, it's like "display something on only the first page." <?php if ($page < 2): ?>Enter what you want to display here<?php endif; ?> There is also a similar global variable called $paged...

title: Example of using the iOS Shortcuts app
contentSnippet: This is the first post on Zenn. This time, I will summarize examples of using the "Shortcuts" that are pre-installed in iOS. What is a shortcut to begin with? Shortcuts are apps pre-installed on iOS and other platforms. Simply put, it is an app that can automate various tasks. At one point, changing the charging sound of the iPhone was a hot topic, but that too can be achieved with Shortcuts. Basically, programming knowledge is not required, but it is possible to execute JavaScript and HTTP requests, which expands the possibilities. In the upcoming macOS update "Monter...
